# The order of packages is significant, because pip processes them in the order
# of appearance. Changing the order has an impact on the overall integration
# process, which may cause wedges in the gate later.
pbr!=0.7,<1.0,>=0.6
Babel<=1.3,>=1.3
SQLAlchemy!=0.9.0,!=0.9.1,!=0.9.2,!=0.9.3,!=0.9.4,!=0.9.5,!=0.9.6,<=0.9.99,>=0.8.4
alembic<=0.7.4,>=0.6.4
anyjson<=0.3.3,>=0.3.3
eventlet<=0.15.2,>=0.15.1
PasteDeploy<=1.5.2,>=1.5.0
Routes!=2.0,<=2.1,>=1.12.3
WebOb<=1.3.1,>=1.2.3
wsgiref>=0.1.2
argparse
ordereddict<=1.1
kombu<=3.0.15,>=2.5.0
lockfile<=0.8,>=0.8
pycrypto<=2.6.1,>=2.6
psutil<2.0.0,>=1.1.1
iso8601<=0.1.10,>=0.1.9
six<=1.9.0,>=1.7.0
netaddr<=0.7.13,>=0.7.12
PyYAML<=3.10,>=3.1.0
jsonpatch<=1.3,>=1.1
keystonemiddleware<1.4.0,>=1.0.0

# For paste.util.template used in keystone.common.template
Paste<=1.7.5.1

passlib<=1.6.2
jsonschema<3.0.0,>=2.0.0
python-keystoneclient<1.2.0,>=0.10.0

# not listed in global requirements
